snippet: Eye specialists are offering young patients a contentious remedy to nearsightedness: contact lenses that temporarily flatten the cornea overnight and correct vision for the next day.
abstract: Some optometrists are offering treatment called orthokeratology to children suffering from myopia; treatment uses special contact lenses that flatten cornea while worn overnight, resulting in clear vision that lasts for one full day; some clinicians worry that benefits of lenses may not be worth long-term risks.
lead_paragraph: Eye specialists are offering young patients a contentious remedy to nearsightedness: contact lenses that temporarily flatten the cornea overnight and correct vision for the next day.

headline.main: A Debatable Fix for Young Eyes
